page.title: 16LOCAL EVENTS IN SHERE
page.content: Every Summer in Shere there is a Fair in the Square, it always takes place on a Sunday in the square. This event has been taking place for fifteen years. There is always a theme such as Victorian last year and its going French this year. There are many stalls in the square and a fancy dress competition for the children and Shere School children always do country dancing. I was chosen to dance for the Fair in the Square. We had to wear a tie, white shirt and shorts. We did four dances, we did 'Bonnie Prince Charlie','Music Man','Fun of the Fair' and 'Durham Reel'. There were lots of people watching us, some of the people were Mrs. Colmer's dancing friends. After the dance Mrs.Colmer's friends said it was very good. The people who did the dancing all had an ice-cream. By Ben Howard age 8
